### Tender Notice: Emergency Diesel Fuel

#### Solicitation Details

* **Solicitation Number**: EP076-190001
* **Tender Closing Date**: December 20, 2023, 14:00
* **Amendment Number**: 1
* **Publication Date**: December 23, 2022
* **Government Contracting Authority**: Public Works and Government Services Canada

#### Brief Description

Trade Agreement: Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO-GPA), Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP), Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement, Canada-UK Trade Continuity Agreement

This tender notice is for the supply and delivery of diesel fuel for generators at government facilities within the National Capital Area. The offeror must have the capacity to respond to emergency situations and provide diesel fuel on an as-and-when-required basis. Regional Individual Standing Offers will be issued for each province, with a total of up to ten options. The contract may also be used to provide diesel fuel to other government facilities within the National Capital Area.

#### Deliverables

The successful offeror must have the capacity to deliver diesel fuel to government facilities in the National Capital Area, including:

* Government-owned facilities
* Government-collaboration facilities
* Third-party owned facilities, subject to approval.

#### Method of Bid Submission

Responses to this solicitation must be submitted using the Get Access Canada site. All information will be available on the enclosed documents.

#### Evaluation Criteria

Proposals will be evaluated based on the following criteria:

* Price
* Technical merit

The Public Service and Procurement Canada (PSPC) retains the right to discuss the proposal with any and all respondents. This solicitation is open until December 20, 2023, 14:00. All questions should be directed to the contact listed below.
